>I've got a big (kabīr) cock. So when the young boy (ṣaghīr) said,
>"Stab my insides and be valiant!"
>I said, "It's not permitted." But he replied,
>"I say it is" so I fucked him on his own authority (taqlīd).
— "Poem 23", Ṣadr ad-Dīn Ibn ʿAbd al-Ḥaqq; 'The Garden of Literary Arts' ('Rawḍ al-ādāb', 1423), Shihāb ad-Dīn al-Ḥijāzī al-Khazrajī.

To provide some context, al-Ḥijāzī (the compiler of the anthology featuring the poem in question) was born in Cairo, which during the 15th century was the capital of the Mamluk Sultanate, an empire that encompassed Egypt, the Levant region, and Western Arabia.
